section.p: , and the service definition templates for , are distributed as Redhat (yum/rpm) packages. The packages are available at public repositories maintained by . The Docker images that requires are available at the Docker Hub repository. So, the default installation process requires internet access. However, all of the repositories may be mirrored, so offline installations are supported as well.
section.note: To install , you need a login account for the Docker Hub repository, and permission to pull images from it. For more information, see .
The Docker images for are available in a public repository at Docker Hub. No special permissions are required to pull the images.
section.p: The and packages require approximately 5GB of storage space.
